comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: There have clearly been plenty of "Buffalo strikes" from a search of the NYT. Perhaps associated with the April 1913 strike "of the motormen and conductors employed by the international Railway Company ." I think the date on the negative is 4/11/13. See NYT, April 12, 1913 BUFFALO STRIKE OFF; MAYOR BRINGS PEACE; Company Takes Back Its Men and Differences Will Be Adjusted. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9901E7DB1F3AE633A... The article notes that three regiments of the Fourth Brigade, National Guard had been on strike duty for three days. Does anyone know if the uniforms are right for that?

comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: The NY State Military museum would probably know, and even be interested in this photo, however does not accept email inquiries www.dmna.state.ny.us/historic/pictures/empire.htm
